Title: Costal Bend LNG starts development of 22.5 mtpa LNG export plant in Texas
Description: Privately held infrastructure development company Coastal Bend said it has initiated the development of a 22.5 mtpa LNG export facility on the Texas Gulf Coast.
Author: JS

Title: EGAS inks short-term charter for Energos Force FSRU
Description: Egypt’s state-owned EGAS has signed a short-term charter agreement for the 174,000 m3 Energos Power floating storage regasification unit (FSRU) - destined initially for Germany’s Stade LNG - which will be deployed at the now vacant Aqaba port in Jordan.
Author: JS

Title: Russian shadow fleet vessel heads towards Arctic LNG 2
Description: The 174,000 m3 Iris LNG tanker has entered the Gulf of Ob, containing the 17.4 mtpa Yamal and the sanctioned 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 export plants, with the ship setting course for the latter, eight and a half months after its last loading.
Author: JS

Title: Knutsen delivers first of 10 LNG carriers to QatarEnergy for North Field expansion
Description: Knutsen LNG France, a subsidiary of Norway’s Knutsen Group, has taken delivery of the 174,000 m3 Mraikh LNG carrier from South Korean shipbuilder HD Hyundai, marking the first of 10 LNG carriers being built for long-term charter to QatarEnergy.
Author: CK

Title: Shell denies interest in BP takeover following media speculation
Description: Shell has denied reports suggesting it is exploring a takeover of BP, issuing a rare public clarification in response to recent media speculation.
Author: CK

Title: Germany’s DET postpones Brunsbuettel LNG capacity auction over jetty approval concerns
Description: Germany’s federally owned LNG terminal operator Deutsche Energy Terminal has delayed its planned auction for 2026 short-term regasification capacity at the Brunsbüttel terminal in Schleswig-Holstein, citing unresolved questions over the approval of a new jetty at the site.
Author: CK

Title: LNG Canada set to export first cargo “in a few days”: BC Premier
Description: The Shell-led 14 mtpa LNG Canada project in British Columbia province is poised to export its first cargo “in the next few days,” kicking off Canada’s long-awaited entry into the global LNG export market.
Author: CK
